{'heading24257>>Division 1 — Preliminary' : {'(11) Limitation periods under this Part are extendable etc. under': {'Part 3': {'((1))': 'Divisions 2 and 3 have effect subject to Part 3.', '((2))': 'Subsection (1) is subject to section 28(5).'}}, '(12) When actions commence': {'((1))': 'In this Part a reference to the commencement of an action is a reference to the issue in the appropriate court of a writ or other originating application in relation to the action.', '((2))': 'Nothing in subsection (1) affects the operation of section 88.'}}}

{'heading2511265>>Division 2 — General limitation period' : {'(13) General limitation period — 6 years': {'((1)) An action on any cause of action cannot be commenced if': {'optional-context2600268': '6 years have elapsed since the cause of action accrued.'}, '((2))': 'Subsection (1) does not apply to an action if Division 3 provides for a different limitation period for that action.'}}}

{'heading2601270>>Division 3 — Limitation periods for particular causes of action' : {'(14) Personal injury, Fatal Accidents Act 1959 actions — 3 years': {'((1))': 'An action for damages relating to a personal injury to a person cannot be commenced if 3 years have elapsed since the cause of action accrued.', '((2))': 'An action under the Fatal Accidents Act 1959 for damages relating to the death of a person cannot be commenced if 3 years have elapsed since the death.'}, '(15) Defamation — one year from publication': {'optional-context271275': 'An action relating to the publication of defamatory
